news_header: Denmark's GDP grew by 3.6% last year, driven by the pharmaceutical industry, especially Novo Nordisk.
news_original_title: Tanskan talous jyllää – lääketeollisuus ajaa jättikasvua
news_text: According to Danmarks Statistics, Denmark's GDP grew by 3.6% last year, primarily due to the pharmaceutical industry, with Novo Nordisk leading the market. In contrast, Finland's GDP growth was -0.3%. Novo Nordisk's market value is around 360 billion dollars, making it one of the world's most valuable companies.
